body.value: The title "Lucky Strike" immediatley brings to mind the cigarette brand, hinting at a critique of consumer culture  and advertising. In the 1980s, Haring was very aware of how commercial imagery influenced society. He often used brand logos to comment on how corporations shape public opinion and manipulate desires. Using a well-known cigarette brand could represent teh dangers of mass marketing, especially when it comes to health, addiction, and the glamorization of harmful products.

Surrounding the cigarette pack are energetic, radiant lines, which might symbolize the spread of influence or addiction. These lines often suggest movement and expansion, as if cigarette's harmful effects are vibrating outward, respresenting the far-reaching consequences of smoking.

Haring's work frequently features figures that may symbolize people trapped in addiction or reflect the broader societal effects of consumer behavior. These figures, drawn with bold, simplified outlines, are often seen as representing  humanity as a whole, especially in relation to social issues like public health.
